remarks: Convert closure theorem ~ mapdhcl to use ` HDMap1 ` function. (Contributed by NM, 15-May-2015.)
statement:
hdmap1eq2.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
hdmap1eq2.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
hdmap1eq2.v $e |- V = ( Base ` U ) $.
hdmap1eq2.o $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` U ) $.
hdmap1eq2.n $e |- N = ( LSpan ` U ) $.
hdmap1eq2.c $e |- C = ( ( LCDual ` K ) ` W ) $.
hdmap1eq2.d $e |- D = ( Base ` C ) $.
hdmap1eq2.l $e |- L = ( LSpan ` C ) $.
hdmap1eq2.m $e |- M = ( ( mapd ` K ) ` W ) $.
hdmap1eq2.i $e |- I = ( ( HDMap1 ` K ) ` W ) $.
hdmap1eq2.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
hdmap1eq2.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. D ) $.
hdmap1eq2.mn $e |- ( ph -> ( M ` ( N ` { X } ) ) = ( L ` { F } ) ) $.
hdmap1cl.ne $e |- ( ph -> ( N ` { X } ) =/= ( N ` { Y } ) ) $.
hdmap1cl.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. ( V \ { .0. } ) ) $.
hdmap1cl.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. V ) $.
hdmap1cl $p |- ( ph -> ( I ` <. X , F , Y >. ) e. D ) $.
